org.jamesframework.core.search

Class MultiNeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType extends Solution>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.search.Search<SolutionType>
      • org.jamesframework.core.search.LocalSearch<SolutionType>
        • org.jamesframework.core.search.NeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType>
          • org.jamesframework.core.search.MultiNeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType>
  • Type Parameters:
    SolutionType - solution type of the problems that may be solved using this search, required to extend Solution
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReducedVariableNeighbourhoodSearch, VariableNeighbourhoodDescent, VariableNeighbourhoodSearch

    public abstract class MultiNeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType extends Solution>
extends NeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType>
    Abstract neighbourhood search that uses multiple neighbourhoods to modify the current solution. This includes variable neighbourhood descent and variable neighbourhood search.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

      Create a new multi neighbourhood search, specifying the problem to be solved, the neighbourhoods used to modify the current solution, and a custom search name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiNeighbourhoodSearch

        public MultiNeighbourhoodSearch(Problem<SolutionType> problem,
                                List<? extends Neighbourhood<? super SolutionType>> neighs)
        Create a new multi neighbourhood search, specifying the problem to be solved and the neighbourhoods used to modify the current solution. None of both arguments may be null and the list of neighbourhoods may not be empty and may not contain any null elements The default search name "MultiNeighbourhoodSearch" is assigned.
        Parameters:
        problem - problem to be solved
        neighs - neighbourhoods used to modify the current solution
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if problem or neighs are null, or if neighs contains a null element
        IllegalArgumentException - if neighs is empty

      • MultiNeighbourhoodSearch

        public MultiNeighbourhoodSearch(String name,
                                Problem<SolutionType> problem,
                                List<? extends Neighbourhood<? super SolutionType>> neighs)
        Create a new multi neighbourhood search, specifying the problem to be solved, the neighbourhoods used to modify the current solution, and a custom search name. The problem and neighbourhood list may not be null and the neighbourhood list may not be empty and may not contain any null elements. The search name may be null in which case the default name "MultiNeighbourhoodSearch" is assigned.
        Parameters:
        name - custom search name
        problem - problem to be solved
        neighs - neighbourhoods used to modify the current solution
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if problem or neighs are null, or if neighs contains a null element
        IllegalArgumentException - if neighs is empty

    • Method Detail

      • getNeighbourhoods

        public List<? extends Neighbourhood<? super SolutionType>> getNeighbourhoods()
        Get an unmodifiable view of the list of applied neighbourhoods.
        Returns:
        unmodifiable view of neighbourhood list

      • setNeighbourhoods

        public void setNeighbourhoods(List<? extends Neighbourhood<? super SolutionType>> neighs)
        Sets the list of neighbourhoods used to modify the current solution. Note that neighs can not be null nor empty and can not contain any null elements. This method may only be called when the search is idle. It should be used with care for searches that have already been run before and will be restarted later, as updating the neighbourhoods might break the execution of a restarted search that tries to continue from where it had arrived.
        Parameters:
        neighs - list of neighbourhoods used to modify the current solution
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if neighs is null or contains any null elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if neighs is empty
        SearchException - if the search is currently not idle
